definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: In the foyer, herringbone hardwood floors with a walnut border were installed.
sentences.chinese: 在門廳裏，人字形硬木地板與核桃邊境被安裝。

sentences.english: Inside the gate is the Xiangtang Hall, where family members commemorate the ancestors or hold meetings.
sentences.chinese: 穿過門廳就是“享堂”，是族人祭祖議事的地方。

sentences.english: Dozens of servants scurried through the large foyer.
sentences.chinese: 許多僕役在偌大的門廳中快速地穿梭着。

sentences.english: His vest has been left in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 他的汗衫遺留在了門廳。

sentences.english: I saw him in our hallway, around dinnertime.
sentences.chinese: 晚飯時分，我在門廳裏見到了他。

sentences.english: Or sometimes they stood her up (still fast asleep) in the hallway and let her hold coats and hats.
sentences.chinese: 有時他們還把沉睡的公主立在門廳裏當衣帽架。

sentences.english: The McMullen’s have a giant mural painting along the hallway in their home.
sentences.chinese: 麥克倫家的門廳裏有一幅巨型壁畫。

sentences.english: Jog around the hallway listening to some music.
sentences.chinese: 在門廳裏小跑一下，聽一些音樂。

sentences.english: I dash through the vestibule with visions of vestibule murders.
sentences.chinese: 我急速衝過門廳，滿腦子想的全是那些門廳謀殺事件。

sentences.english: I dash through the vestibule with visions of vestibule murders.
sentences.chinese: 我急速衝過門廳，滿腦子想的全是那些門廳謀殺事件。

sentences.english: Every morning I lay on the floor in the front parlour watching her door.
sentences.chinese: 每天早上我都趴在前門廳的地板上，看着她家的門。

sentences.english: The enormous vaulted ceiling welcomes you into the foyer.
sentences.chinese: 恢弘的拱形天花板聳立在門廳內。

sentences.english: Begin from hallway, face one place to widen dovish airspace with respect to the body.
sentences.chinese: 從門廳開始，就身臨一處開闊穩健的空間。

sentences.english: The entrance halls, the stairs, and the doors, are all covered with graffiti .
sentences.chinese: 門廳，樓梯和門上面畫滿了亂七八糟的東西。

sentences.english: Push open the door, the first location after taking the home is vestibular .
sentences.chinese: 推開門，進家後的第一處所便是門廳了。

sentences.english: The lobby, restaurant, and lounge share one large yet polished space.
sentences.chinese: 門廳，餐廳，休息室設置在一個寬敞明亮的空間裏。

definition: lintel (of a door)/fig. family's social status
